data.title: Greece Archives
data.text:
Since the death of the Constantine II, in January 2023, several members of the Greek royal family have gone public and shown their love for him. The latest is the King’s granddaughter, Princess Olympia of Greece and Denmark. The Greek princess has taken to Instagram this week with two photographs of her late grandfather. The first image shows King Constantine performing martial arts. The…

The final resting place of Constantine II now bears a carved tribute to the last King of Greece. The tombstone was revealed as the 40 day anniversary of the king’s passing was marked with memorial services in Athens and at Tatoi where Constantine was laid to rest in…

Until now, no member of the Greek royal family has commented on the death of Constantine II, the last King of Greece. Now, Princess Tatiana, one of his daughters-in-law, has shared how powerful and emotional the experience of King Constantine’s funeral was for the…

Memorial services for Constantine II, the last King of Greece, are set to be held in the coming months. The first will be in Athens in February when the official royal mourning period for Constantine II comes to an end. Constantine died on January 10th 2023 and was buried from the Metropolitan Cathedral in Athens on January 16th 2023. A memorial service will take place forty days after the…

Tatoi Palace, the former royal residence of the Greek Royal Family, is set to become a public museum. The Athens-based palace will open as a public museum by 2025, according to the country’s Minister of Culture and Sports, Lina Mendoni. The announcement was made…

Tatoi Palace is a Greek estate previously used by the Greek Royal Family for over 100 years as a summer residence. The land was acquired by King George I, who purchased the estate in 1880. Tatoi currently holds the record for the highest-ever recorded temperature in…

To coincide with the funeral of King Constantine II, a Serafimerringning ceremony was held in Riddarholmskyrkan in Stockholm in honour the late King of Greece. Constantine was a knight of the Royal Order of the Seraphim, an honour he was presented with by King Gustaf VI Adolf in September 1964. The Order of the Seraphim is one of the country’s highest honours, awarded for outstanding…

Crown Prince Pavlos paid loving tribute to his late father, the former King Constantine of Greece at his funeral, saying that “This is not the end, father.” In a moving eulogy, Pavlos called the funeral “a painful day of parting for your beloved queen and out…

Their love story had spanned decades and as she said goodbye to her husband of 58 years, Queen Anne-Marie of Greece had a final, moving gesture of love for King Constantine II. The only wreath on his coffin during his funeral service in Athens was from Anne-Marie. It was…
